授業目的: This course allows a student with a high level of Japanese language ability (completion of level 6 and above) to earn credits by working at a local public or private organization and writing a report based on that experience. Exchange students only.
到達目標: This course allows a student with a high level of Japanese language ability (completion of level 6 and above) to earn credits by working at a local public or private organization and writing a report based on that experience. Exchange students only.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Before registering for this course, the student must consult with the course supervisor to discuss the expectations for the internship. The supervisor will then work with the Center for International Education and Cooperation (CIEC) staff to find an appropriate placement for the student. Some possibilities for internships include companies, local
government agencies, social welfare service providers, non-governmental organizations, schools, religious organizations, and so on. As a rule, the supervisor will serve as a liaison between the organization and the student, and will provide guidance when necessary. At the end of the term, the student will submit a report based on observations made during the internship, following guidelines provided by the supervisor.

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
This is a credit/non-credit course. No grade will be given.
The responsible person at the organization hosting the student will be given a questionnaire to complete at the end of the internship. The results of this questionnaire and the report submitted by the student will be the primary subjectives for evaluation by the supervisor. Regular attendance during expected internship hours, cooperative participation in organization activities and the quality of the student report are the main elements which will determine whether the student receives credit or not (pass/fail).
